page.title: 07RELIGIOUS BELIEFS: HULL
page.content: Working with a sample of eight and nine year olds, only half knew they had been Christened, 60% had attended a Sunday School but only 25% continued to attend. 15% of mothers attended a church but only 7% of fathers, so parental influence is small. The conflict between a belief in God, which requires attending a place of worship, and the idea that Sunday is a day of rest and recreation, results in parents withdrawing those children who originally enrolled at a Sunday School (10%). The school assemblies, with communal singing and worship, were enjoyed by 95% of the sample and schools are the only source of spiritual experience for half their pupils. Despite lack of parental commitment, 75% of the sample thought that places of Christian worship would be needed in the future.
